question: The photovoltaic cells of a solar power plant is composed of tempered glass glazing and a EVA coating material with the following optical characteristics: Tempered Glass Glaze: reflectivity 0.12, absorptivity 0.08 EVA coating: reflectivity 0.035, absorptivity 0.92 If there are 700 panels of 2.5 m2 per unit area is installed, determine the power of the plant if the average solar flux is 950 W/m2:

A 20 mi/hr wind at standard temperature and pressure passes through a horizontal wind turbine. The wind is perpendicular to the plate of the blades. The turbine has a blade diameter of 30 ft. Air temperature and pressure is 70 deg.F and 1 atm. What is the maximum power that can generate?

The wind power plant is served by twenty-five units of identical 80 feet-wind turbine and operates on a shoreline with velocity of 150 mph. The efficiency of the turbogenerator set is 0.42. The power capacity of the plant is most nearly:
Calculate the number of fission in uranium per second required to produce 2 kW of power if energy released per fission is 200 MeV.

Assuming that 85% of neutrons absorbed by U-235 cause fission, the rest being absorbed by non-fission capture to produce an isotope U-236, estimate the fuel consumption of U-235 per day to produce 3000 MW of thermal power.

A nuclear reactor is composed of 400 graphite-coated U-235 fuel such that every rod has a fission rate of $5 \times 10^{15}$ /sec/rod. Determine the daily fuel consumption of this power plant if the capture efficiency, primary loop efficiency, secondary loop efficiency and turbogenerator efficiency are 0.35, 0.92, 0.86, 0.80, respectively.

A power station supplies the following loads to the consumers: | Time in hours | 0-6 | 6-10 | 10-12 | 12-16 | 16-20 | 20-22 | 22-24 | | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- | | Load in MW | 30 | 70 | 90 | 60 | 100 | 80 | 60 | Determine:
The load factor: A. 0.45, B. 0.89, C. 0.65, D. 0.35
Use factor of a standby equipment of 300 MW capacity if it takes up all loads above 70 MW: A. 0.85, B. 0.75, C. 0.65, D. 0.45
A cogenerative plant has a maximum demand of 55 MW with a load factor of 0.7 and capacity factor of 0.5. The plant capacity is nearly:
A hydro-power plant in Cordillera has the following annual factors: load factor = 0.75, capacity factor = 0.60, use factor = 0.65. Maximum demand is 60 MW. Estimate:
The annual energy production, in GWh: A. 447.4, B. 394.2, C. 277.3, D. 573.3
The hours during which the plant is not in service per year: A. 548 hrs, B. 732 hrs, C. 647 hrs, D. 534 hrs
A main power station has annual factors: Capacity factor=40%, Load Factor = 55%, Use Factor = 42%. The reserve above the peak load is 8500 kW. Find:
The annual energy production in MWh: A. 109,000, B. 203,000, C. 45,700, D. 67,900
Hours per year not in service: A. 418 hrs, B. 568 hrs, C. 312 hrs, D. 70 hrs
A power plant has a fuel consumption of 1 pound per kW-hr generated. Determine the heating value of the fuel used in BTU per pound. The overall efficiency of the plant is 36%.
The current loads of four circuits are: Circuit 1 = 25 A, Circuit 2 = 38 A, Circuit 3 = 18 A, Circuit 4 = 45 A. If the diversity factor is 1.5, what is the minimum ampacity of the feeder:
A power consumer in Nueva Ecija has four feeder circuits of 220 V, 3-phase. Circuits demands: A: 35 A, B: 46 A, C: 72 A, D: 57 A. If diversity factor is 1.5, determine max demand:
A central generating station report: CF = 50%, LF = 60%, UF = 45%, Reserved = 10,500 kW. Determine rated capacity:
